snippet: Concerned about Wal-Mart’s reported cover-up of bribery, leaders of New York City’s pension funds said they would vote their 4.7 million company shares against five directors standing for re-election.
abstract: Leaders of New York City’s pension funds, concerned about Wal-Mart's reported cover-up of bribery, say they will vote their 4.7 million company shares against five directors standing for re-election to the retailer's board at its annual shareholder meeting in June.
lead_paragraph: Concerned about Wal-Mart’s reported cover-up of bribery, leaders of New York City’s pension funds said they would vote their 4.7 million company shares against five directors standing for re-election.

headline.seo: New York Pension Funds to Challenge Wal-Mart
headline.main: New York Pension Funds to Challenge Wal-Mart
headline.print_headline: New York Pension Funds To Challenge Wal-Mart
